SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To present the case of an elite female basketball player with Marfan syndrome diagnosed after a heart murmur was found on preparticipation screening examination
BACKGROUND: Undetected Marfan syndrome can result in sudden death during competition or practice
While those with Marfan syndrome often present with characteristic skeletal and ocular manifestations, the condition can go unnoticed if the athlete is not exceptionally lean

TREATMENT: After a heart murmur was detected on a preparticipation examination, the athlete was referred to a cardiologist, who advised the athlete to discontinue vigorous athletic activity and undergo surgery to replace the ascending aorta and aortic valve with a composite graft tube and valve
She is presently waiting to undergo surgery
UNIQUENESS: The athlete had neither an ectomorphic body build nor a family history of Marfan syndrome
CONCLUSIONS: ATHLETIC TRAINERS CAN PLAY AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN THE EARLY DETECTION OF MARFAN SYNDROME VIA A SIMPLE SCREENING PROCEDURE: comparing the athlete's arm span and height
